intro: Gynoisa carolina, commonly known as Carolina gynoisa, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant features small, white, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in a fine, silvery pubescence. Gynoisa carolina typically grows in moist, acidic soils and is often found in woodland habitats.
